title: Electric field between plates of a capacitor

content.question: A capacitor fully charged by a <math alttext="6 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> battery has <math alttext="12 nanocoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>nC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of charge stored on its plates. The area of its plates is <math alttext="12 square meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> . The space between the plates is filled with pieces of paper that have dielectric constant <math alttext="2.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The electric field between the plates of the capacitor is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="6 times 10 to the power negative 9 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.77 times 10 to the power negative 2 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.77</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4.7 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="28.3 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="56.5 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>56.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="56.5 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>56.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
